paper.title: Subtractive reductions and complete problems for counting complexity classes

author.org: LACL, Department of Computer Science, Université Paris, Créteil, France
LIX, Ecole Polytechnique, Palaiseau Cedex, France
Computer Science Dept, Univ. of California, Santa Cruz, CA#TAB#

paper.abstract: We introduce and investigate a new type of reductions between counting problems, which we call subtractive reductions. We show that the main counting complexity classes #P, #NP, as well as all higher counting complexity classes # ċ ΠkP, k ≥ 2, are closed under subtractive reductions. We then pursue problems that are complete for these classes via subtractive reductions. We focus on the class #NP (which is the same as the class # ċ coNP) and show that it contains natural complete problems via subtractive reductions, such as the problem of counting the minimal models of a Boolean formula in conjunctive normal form and the problem of counting the cardinality of the set of minimal solutions of a homogeneous system of linear Diophantine inequalities.
